Package ser321.media

Class MusicLibraryGui

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
ser321.media.MusicLibraryGui
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class MusicLibraryGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
Copyright (c) 2020 Tim Lindquist, Software Engineering, Arizona State University at the Polytechnic campus

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation version 2 of the License.

so you are aware of the terms and your rights with regard to this software.

Or, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301,USA

Purpose: MusicLibraryGui creates a window with a File menu having Save, and Exit menu items. The window also has a Music menu with Add, Remove, and Play menu items. The window is a split pane with scroll pane on each side. The left scroll pane has a tree, which should is used to display the music library structure -- based on albums. The right scroll pane has the JTextField for viewing the selected Title MusicLibraryGui is the View class and contains protected definitions for its members. This allows an extending class MusicThread, which is the control class, access to the GUI components for implementing the control logic (playing, removing, adding).

Ser321 Principles of Distributed Software Systems

See Also:
Ser321 Home Page, Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • tree

      protected javax.swing.JTree tree
      tree is the JTree displayed in the left pane of the window.

    • menuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] menuNames
      String array of menu names The array's value is: {"File","Music"}

    • fileMenuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] fileMenuNames
      Array of strings naming the action commands for File menu. The array's value is: {"Save","Exit"}.

    • musicMenuNames

      protected java.lang.String[] musicMenuNames
      Array of strings naming the action commands for Music menu. The array's value is: {"Add","Remove","Play"}.

    • userMenuItems

      protected javax.swing.JMenuItem[][] userMenuItems
      The menu items. Each entry in the array is a JMenuItem. userMenuItems is an array of arrays. Each sub array contains the JMenuItem objects for the menus (File and Music). Note the order in this array matches the order in menuNames arrays.

    • menuItemNames

      protected java.lang.String[][] menuItemNames
      The menu item names. menuItemNames is an array of arrays. Note the order in this array matches the order in menu names array.

    • titleJTF

      protected javax.swing.JTextField titleJTF
      The JTextField for entering the title of the music.

  • Constructor Details

    • MusicLibraryGui

      public MusicLibraryGui​(java.lang.String base)

  • Method Details

    • buildInitialTree

      protected void buildInitialTree​(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode root, java.lang.String base)
      create and initialize nodes in the JTree of the left pane. buildInitialTree is called by MusicLibraryGui to initialize the JTree. Classes that extend MusicLibraryGui should override this method to provide initialization actions specific to the extended class. The default functionality is to set base as the label of root.
      Parameters:
      root - Is the root node of the tree to be initialized.
      base - Is the label of the root node of the tree.
